author: jecollet
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell                
 Copy-Item -ToSession $s foo bar
```

# Expected behavior
The item is copied

# Actual behavior
```none
Copy-Item : The term 'PSCopyRemoteUtils' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
At line:1 char:1
+ Copy-Item -ToSession $s foo bar
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (PSCopyRemoteUtils:String) [Get-Command], CommandNotFoundException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetCommandCommand
```

# Environment data
```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: jecollet
comments.body: This seems dependent on the host being copied to.

comments.author: jecollet
comments.body: This is because the remote session was using a configuration that disabled Copy-Item

title: Copy-Item -ToSession fails with strange message
